title: Electrical Engineering Officer Job at Emzor Pharmaceutical Industries Limited
content:
Emzor Pharmaceutical Industries Limited is a wholly private indigenous pharmaceutical manufacturing group founded in 1984 by Dr. Stella C. Okoli, OON. The company is into the manufacture of high quality pharmaceutical products and medical consumables. Today, Emzor has become a household name in Nigeria and a leader in the pharmaceutical market that is known for quality products at prices that offer real value. These products are widely distributed throughout Nigeria and the West African coast. Our commitment is to produce and deliver flawless products on time and every time.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Position: Electrical Engineering Officer
Job Location: Mainland, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking an experienced and result-driven Electrical Engineering Officer to manage and maintain electrical systems across our pharmaceutical manufacturing plant.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for the reliability, safety, and regulatory compliance of all electrical infrastructure, contributing to the overall equipment effectiveness (OEE) and continuous production efficiency.


Key Responsibilities


	Lead the execution of preventive and corrective maintenance for electrical systems, panels, and industrial automation equipment.
	Supervise electrical installations, modifications, and commissioning of new machinery or system upgrades.
	Troubleshoot complex electrical issues across production lines, utility systems, and building infrastructure to minimize downtime.
	Provide technical mentorship to junior electrical staff and support their skill development.
	Support the qualification and validation of electrical components in manufacturing and utility systems.
	Ensure all electrical equipment complies with GMP, WHO, and NAFDAC standards.
	Monitor electrical energy usage and propose strategies for efficiency improvement and cost reduction.
	Maintain comprehensive electrical documentation including P&IDs, schematics, and logbooks for audit readiness.
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams—engineering, production and QA/QC—to ensure safe and efficient operations.


Qualifications & Experience


	B.Eng. or HND in Electrical/Electronic Engineering.
	Minimum of 5 years of hands-on electrical engineering experience in a GMP-regulated pharmaceutical or industrial manufacturing setting.
	NABTEB.
	Trade Test 1,2 & 3


Key Competencies:


	Strong expertise in electrical power systems, control panels, automation, and industrial instrumentation.
	Skilled in reading and interpreting electrical schematics, P&IDs, and technical documentation.
	In-depth knowledge of PLCs, SCADA systems, variable speed drives (VSDs), and control logic.
	Good communication, and technical reporting skills.
	High attention to detail, analytical thinking, and a commitment to safety and compliance.


 What We Offer


	Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses.
	A supportive and dynamic work environment with clear career growth opportunities.
	Comprehensive medical insurance, pension, and other employee benefits.

title: Marketing Manager Job at Recruit with Adenike
content:
Recruit with Adenike is a recruitment and talent solutions brand committed to connecting high-performing professionals with forward-thinking organizations across diverse industries. From entry-level roles to executive placements, we help businesses attract, engage, and retain the right talent to fuel growth and success. Our approach is efficient, personalized, and rooted in a deep understanding of people and business needs.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Marketing Manager
Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports To: Country Head

About the Role
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a highly strategic and experienced Marketing Manager to lead and execute our marketing initiatives in Nigeria. Based onsite in Ikeja, Lagos, this role is ideal for a marketing leader with a solid track record in the fintech or financial services sector.
	You will be responsible for driving product visibility, customer acquisition, retention, and brand growth across multiple channels. Reporting directly to the Country Head, you will work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure our marketing strategy supports business objectives.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and implement end-to-end marketing strategies for fintech products (e.g., digital payments, wallets, loans)
	Plan and execute digital campaigns (SEO, SEM, paid media, email marketing, content marketing)
	Collaborate with internal teams (product, sales, compliance) to align messaging and positioning
	Lead market research initiatives to understand customer behavior and market trends
	Oversee go-to-market planning for new product features and launches
	Manage performance marketing and analyze key metrics to measure ROI
	Build and maintain brand identity and customer engagement across touchpoints
	Manage vendor relationships, marketing budgets, and external agencies
	Ensure compliance with regulatory standards (e.g., CBN, NDPR) in all communications


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business Administration, or related field
	Minimum of 7 years of relevant marketing experience, with at least 3 years in fintech or financial services
	Proven experience managing digital marketing campaigns and driving measurable growth
	Strong knowledge of tools like Google Analytics, Meta Ads Manager, CRM platforms, and marketing automation tools
	Excellent communication, project management, and stakeholder management skills
	Analytical mindset and ability to interpret data into actionable strategy
	Ability to lead cross-functional initiatives and work in a fast-paced environment


Preferred Qualifications:


	Master’s degree or certifications in marketing or digital strategy
	Experience working in high-growth startups or scaling tech products
	Familiarity with financial regulations and marketing compliance standards in Nigeria
	Team leadership or mentorship experience is a plus


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitmentforce.africa@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Social Media Manager Job at AK Entertainment
content:
AK Entertainment is an innovative online platform dedicated to providing an immersive and engaging experience for players worldwide. At AK Entertainment, we prioritize community and interaction, offering features like leader boards, and social integration to enhance your experience. Join us and explore a world of endless entertainment, where excitement and camaraderie come together!

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media Manager

Job Location: Jabi, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time (On-site)

Job Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	As a Social Media Manager, you will be responsible for developing and implementing our social media strategy to enhance brand awareness and engagement.
	You will create, curate, and manage published content across various platforms, analyze performance metrics, and engage with our online community.

	Develop and execute social media campaigns.
	Create and schedule daily content across platforms (e.g., Facebook, Twitter, Tiktok, Instagram, WhatsApp, Telegram).

Salary
N200,000 monthly.

Method of Application

title: Business Development Manager Job at Lagos Business School
content:
Lagos Business School is committed to creating and transmitting management and business knowledge based on a Christian conception of the human person and of economic activity relevant to Nigeria and Africa at large. We strive to be a world class business school which will have a significant impact on the practice of management.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Manager

Job Location: Lagos

Purpose of Position
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The jobholder will strategically position Lagos Business School as the premier provider of bespoke learning solutions and a trusted partner in co-creating corporate academy frameworks.
	This role involves designing and managing tailored corporate learning experiences while driving the uptake of our academy solutions and management services.
	The incumbent will enhance client acquisition and retention efforts to ensure long-term business sustainability, while consistently delivering prompt, professional, and customer-centric service.


Essential Duties / Key Job Roles and Responsibilities 
include but are not limited to the following:


	Design, propose, and execute innovative corporate learning solutions tailored to public sector institutions and corporate academies, ensuring alignment with client needs and institutional goals.
	Identify and convert opportunities by positioning open enrolment programmes and seminars as customised solutions that address unique client challenges.
	Promote Lagos Business School’s state-of-the-art physical and virtual learning facilities as integrated learning solutions for organisational capability development.
	Build, nurture, and manage long-term relationships with prospects and existing clients to generate referrals, secure repeat business, and strengthen LBS’s market position.
	Drive debt recovery efforts and enforce adherence to the School’s credit policy for all programmes and services under your portfolio.
	Maintain an accurate, up-to-date CRM database of clients, prospects, and their affiliated organisations to enable effective marketing, segmentation, and reporting.
	Serve as the proposal development lead and strategic engagement partner for assigned corporate clients, ensuring timely and competitive submissions.
	Consistently meet and aim to exceed set revenue and growth targets through strategic client engagement and value delivery.
	Ensure timely fee payment by corporate clients, strictly following standard operating procedures and internal controls.
	Collaborate cross-functionally with programme managers, faculty, and other stakeholders to ensure the seamless execution and successful completion of executive education programmes.
	Contribute to continuous improvement and innovation in programme delivery, client engagement, and business development processes.
	Carry out other duties or special assignments as may be delegated by the line manager, in alignment with strategic business objectives.


Key Performance Indicators:


	Achieving agreed target revenues.
	Diversity of client portfolio across industry segments
	Achievement of agreed participant ratings per programme
	Feedback from customers- both internal and external


.Requirements 


	A minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree from a reputable tertiary institution is required, while a master’s degree will be considered an added advantage
	Proven experience in sales, account management, banking, FMCG, business development, consulting, or project management will be a strong asset, offering valuable perspectives and transferable skills that enhance strategic client engagement and solution delivery.


Competencies Required:
To be successful in this role, the role holder should possess the following:


	Must have a demonstrated professional demeanor and proven ability to work on complex projects as a team leader and initiator.
	Must have an eye for detail, a drive for efficiency, and a passion for creativity and innovation.
	Able to work in a fast-paced environment and be calm under pressure, with the ability to analyze situations and respond quickly to deliver effective solutions.
	Able to establish and maintain effective working relationships with client-organisations, participants and co-workers.
	Ability to keep and maintain accurate records, read, analyze, and interpret commercial data.
	Proficient with Microsoft Office, the school’s admissions and customer data tracking software including Odoo.
	Knowledge of sales funnel methodology, market segmentation, product and channels development.
	Excellent oral and written communication and business presentation skills.

title: Finance and Administrative Assistant Job at Cooperazione Internazionale
content:
COOPI - Cooperazione Internazionale is an Italian humanitarian non-governmental organization founded in Milan in 1965. COOPI aims to help the world’s poorest to improve their access to healthcare, food, and financial security, and to overcome their special vulnerability to wars, civil conflicts and natural disasters. For 50 years of long-term support and constant presence in the field, COOPI has been engaged in breaking the cycle of poverty and responding to specific emergencies in numerous sectors, including Food Security, Humanitarian Aid, Health, Socio-Economical Services, Water and Sanitation, Disaster Risk Reduction, Human Rights, Education and Training, Migrations and Sustainable Energy.
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Finance and Administrative Assistant
Job Location: Sokoto
Employment Type: Full-time
Project / Programme: BHA
Reports To: Project Administrator
Startin Date: ASAP

Job Summary


	The Finance/Administrative Assistant is responsible for executing all the tasks concerning Finance and administrative duties in the field office in Sokoto.


Main Responsibilities and Tasks
Under the direct supervision of the Project Administrator, and in collaboration with the Country office and other collaborators of the projects and of the Base, he/she will:

Finance Task:


	Ensure the proper management of project accounting by the COOPI procedures and those of the donor guidelines.
	Ensure the correct management of the project cash (cashbox and bank) and, in particular, the monthly reconciliation under the supervision of the Project Administrator;
	Process vendor payments and maintain strict control over all required documentation, including adherence to procurement procedures, and reporting any discrepancies to the Project Administrator
	Organize, file, and scan all payment vouchers with related supporting documents;
	Participate in audits or any checks issued by partners or head office, at the base level.
	Participate in the consolidation of budget follow-ups and cash forecasts at the base level.
	Carry out pay-outs and advances, within established guidelines
	Prepare, classify, and archive all accounting elements required by the Project Administrator.
	Supervise the physical maintenance and safety of cash boxes.
	Keep the registry of cash pay-outs and the cashier’s register
	Record budgetary transfers and keep accounting codes
	Prepare monthly closing, revision, and integrity of accounts for the base
	Verify cash balances daily and report any discrepancies to superior
	Archive accounting records according to COOPI’s procedures after a final verification of receipts etc.
	Guarantee the security of the cash and confidentiality of information.
	Pay monthly tax and social taxes under the supervision of the Project Administrator
	Assist the Project Administrator with monthly budget forecasts and planning so that day-to-day needs, salary advances, salaries, etc. can be addressed.


Admin Task:


	Do bank runs including transfer requests, withdrawals, and issuing/receiving letters and bank statements, etc.
	Additional responsibilities
	This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive and the employee will also perform other related tasks as required and assigned by the Project Administrator, and coordination office.
	This ToR shall be inclusive of any other task specifically assigned by the direct supervisor for what concerns the implementation of the program activities.


Skills and competencies of the Candidate (Education, Training, Competences, Skills)
Minimum Requirements:


	Degree/Diploma of Post-graduate degree in Accountancy, Social Science courses, Business Management, Business Administration, Public Administration, or related subject, with previous experience working in humanitarian projects.
	and evidence of NYSC discharge certificate, with previous experience working in developmental and emergency projects, especially in NGO/INGO or financial sector.


Desired Competencies / Skills:
Essential:


	2-3 years of Finance related work experience with an NGO, International NGO, and any other financial-related institution.
	Experience in data collection, collation and archiving
	Work-related skills: good knowledge of cash management, daily administration tasks, logistics and procurement tasks
	Fluency in English
	Ability to plan and organize work write clear and concise reports and communicate effectively (both in writing and verbally)
	Proven ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines
	Excellent communication skills.
	Proven commitment to accountability
	Excellent computer skills with proficiency in MS Excel.
	Strong analysis skills (qualitative and qualitative)
	Excellent interpersonal skills, written and verbal communications
	Strong cultural awareness and sensitivity
	Good understanding of complex emergencies and crisis contexts
	Demonstrated skills in management, teamwork, negotiation and consensus-building
	Females are strongly encouraged to apply
	Applicants with disabilities are strongly encouraged to apply.


Preferred:


	Excellent knowledge of English, with a fair understanding of Hausa.
	Willing and able to be based and travel regularly within remote areas, where services are limited.


Basic Salary


	According to COOPI salary grid.


 

Note


	Female and People With Disabilities are strongly encouraged to apply
	Application shall be treated on a rolling basis.
